sanskrit_verse:
त्रीणि देवाः पवित्राणि ब्राह्मणानामकल्पयन् ।
अदृष्टमद्भिर्निर्णिक्तं यच्च वाचा प्रशस्यते ॥ ५.१२७॥
transliteration:
trīṇi devāḥ pavitrāṇi brāhmaṇānāmakalpayan |
adṛṣṭamadbhirnirṇiktaṃ yacca vācā praśasyate || 5.127||
sph_interpretive_translation: The three sacred purifications of the Brahmin were established by the Devatas: that which is unseen yet discerned through inner clarity, and that which is praised through speech.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from divine cognition, not human institution
Causation is validated through both perceptual and supra-perceptual pramāṇas
Capacity-based responsibility arises from access to supra-sensory discernment
Restoration logic aligns action with inherent spiritual clarity
Consciousness alignment is affirmed through ritual purity and truthful expression
executable_legal_axioms: IF actor has access to supra-sensory discernment THEN action is evaluated against unseen yet cognized dharma
IF speech aligns with revealed truth THEN act is deemed praiseworthy under celestial validation
IF purification process is disrupted THEN restoration protocol initiates via consciousness-realigning rituals
IF individual lacks access to higher discernment THEN capacity restoration precedes adjudication
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that the highest judicial authority must recognize divine cognition as a valid source of law. Legal decisions must integrate unseen truths known through purified consciousness alongside verbal testimony. Responsibility is determined based on one's access to and alignment with supra-perceptual discernment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality recognizes that divine insight constitutes a legitimate epistemic instrument. Anupūrvaśaḥ indicates that actions stem from levels of awareness accessible through purification. Proportional responsibility corresponds to the degree of alignment with inner clarity. The non-punitive reality rule affirms that misalignment calls for purification rather than penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate śuddhi-kriyā (purification process) to restore access to inner discernment
Engage in sākṣātkāra-based reflection to realign consciousness with revealed truth
Establish vāk-saṃskāra (speech refinement) practices to ensure alignment with prashastha-vāk (praised speech)
Implement guru-guided adhikāra-assessment to determine appropriate level of ritual and cognitive reintegration
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. Justice flows from consciousness clarity, not punitive force. Reality responds to alignment, not fear. Brahman alone adjudicates through purified insight.
